intro: Orbignya sabulosa, commonly known as the Brazilian palm or the sand palm, is a tropical plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is a member of the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, multi-stemmed trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, round fruits that contain a single seed. Orbignya sabulosa is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas, making it a hardy and resilient species. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
